intro: Tetranthera angulata, commonly known as the angular tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive angular leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
